title: Girl, 17, dies after falling from bridge over busy road
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A teenager has died after falling from a bridge onto a busy dual carriageway.

The 17-year-old girl died after dropping from the structure overlooking the A56 near Haslingden, Lancashire at around 1pm today.

Emergency services rushed to the scene but the young woman died a short while after they arrived, Lancashire Live reported.

Her death is not thought to be suspicious, police said.

"The woman’s next of kin have been informed and our thoughts are with them and the rest of her family and friends at this difficult time," a Lancashire Police spokesperson said.

"A file will be prepared for HM Coroner and police are requesting any witnesses to this tragic incident who have not yet spoken to police, or any drivers with dashcam footage to contact them on 101 quoting log 647 of October 14."

(Image: LIVERPOOL ECHO)

A North West Ambulance Service air ambulance was sent to the scene along with an advanced paramedic and rapid response vehicle.

The road was closed going both ways for several hours after the death.

There were queues stretching back several miles as the emergency services worked at the scene.

John McNamara, a detective sargeant with the Lancashire Police, sent his condolences to the girl's family.

"Tragic," he wrote.

"I hope everyone is okay and my thoughts are with that poor girl’s family. Look after each other."

Others Tweeted their sorrow.

One woman wrote: "This is incredibly sad. We live in a world with limited mental health services. Sending love to her family."

Another added: "Oh this is so sad my heart goes out to her family but also those who found her x"

If you need to speak to someone, Samaritans are available 24/7 on 116 123 or by emailing jo@samaritans.org
description: The teenager has died after falling onto the A56 near Haslingden, in Lancashire
